intro: Racosperma gonocarpum, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It has a woody stem with a rough, fibrous bark and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Racosperma gonocarpum is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal and dry inland areas.
